database

Class ConnectionPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.ConnectionPool

  • public class ConnectionPool
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple connection pool that is made to be initialized at the start of the program to minimize resource usage during the programs run-time. Starts off with a size of 5 connections. Adds new connections when needed until it reaches 10 connections.
    See Also:
    Database

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static ConnectionPool create()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Initializes the connection pool. Creates # of connections as INITIAL_POOL_SIZE indicates Gets driver information from the local config object class.
        Returns:
        null on error, or new ConnectionPool on success
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong
        See Also:
        Database

      • createConnection

        private static java.sql.Connection createConnection()
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new connection. This is used during initialization or when INITIAL_POOL_SIZE is less than # of connections is less than MAX_POOL_SIZE
        Returns:
        a newly created connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong
        See Also:
        Database

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
        Fetches a connection from the connection pool If connection pool is empty, it will create a new connection Puts the used connection in the usedConnections list, and removes it from the connectionPool list
        Returns:
        a connection on success, null on failure
        See Also:
        Database

      • releaseConnection

        public void releaseConnection(java.sql.Connection con)
        Puts the connection back into the connectionPool after usage.
        Parameters:
        con - A connection
        See Also:
        Database

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        A simple getter that returns # of initialized connections.
        Returns:
        int # of connections
        See Also:
        Database

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Shuts down all connections. Adds all used connections back into the connection pool, then proceeds to close all of them. Clears the lists to make sure they are all empty. Used during the shutdown of the program
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong :)
        See Also:
        Database

        Returns an integer with the pool size.

        int
